intro: Tricalysia dubia, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often with a compact, bushy habit. Its flowers are usually pink, white, or purple, and they bloom throughout the year under proper care. Tricalysia dubia is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
